poem:
### The Ascent

Perched on a precipice,  
Hunter and Becky defy gravity,  
laughter tethered by fear.  
The sky an unsettling canvas,  
each gust a reminder of Dan's fall.  
Flight or fall, heartbeats echo  
against steel and sky.  
High above the earth's stillness,  
the climb becomes a quiet  
resurrection of courage.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Thrill-seeking climbing influencer Hunter convinces her bestie Becky to do a little immersion therapy after her husband Dan’s sudden death during a climb leaves her". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
